content.description: Start directly below a large pod about 50 ft up.  Climb up fun pockets with a couple big moves to a good rest.  Make a very difficult crux move (can be done several ways).  Once at the large pod move slightly right and meet up with White Rhino.
content.location: between White Rhino and Clips from the Bong.  The left variation that enters the pod.

content.description: More fun 12a pocket climbing. Follow a white water streak straight up and to the right of the large pod on Yukon Gold.
content.location: Right of Yukon Gold. The right variation that enters the pod.

content.description: One of the better warm-ups on the head wall. 11b to the first set of anchors. 11c if you continue though the slab to the upper anchors. Long moves on good holds.
content.location: Furthest left of the 4 11's at the start of the head wall. 4th route in from the right side of the head wall.

content.description: A more unique line at the headwall, this thing is sustained for the majority of the lower section and lets up a bit towards the top. Great line that climbs various features. Rad!
content.location: Just to the left of Ghost in the Shell.

content.description: Great line of pocket pulling that shares the finish with The Bean Fiddler. A very worthy route that is on par with The Bean Fiddler with a easier crux.
content.protection:
bolts, biners at the top.

7-8 bolts total.
content.location: Just to the right of The Bean Fiddler, shares the last two bolts and anchors.  Tan hangers and one orange hanger.

content.description: AKA (Line of Weakness) Quite sharp but good movement. Short route, but a good warm up for the head wall if the others are taken. The extension is Bad Ass Weed 5.12a.
content.protection: 5 Bolts to Clips on the anchor.
content.location: Route just to the right of Ghost in the Shell. Goes up the obvious black, jagged line of weakness and ends at the mid anchors.

content.description: Another good route.
content.location: Just right of obvious Line of Weakness near fallen tree with roots exposed.

content.description: Starts on the leftmost part of the Headwall down the hill a bit from Ghost in the Shell. It climbs up and right to a ledge on somewhat sharp rock. At the ledge it goes up and continues right towards the crack on incredible pockets. It then trends left and up to chains.
content.location: leftmost route at the Headwall.

content.description: Fun little route with a couple reachy cruxes.
content.location: This route is in between Stems and Seeds and Seven Arrows. Painted hangers.

content.description: Extension to Middle Man.  Climb Clips to Middle Man, clip one of the chains and take off into a 3 bolt bouldery crux.  Big moves with thin holds make for a very fun and engaging crux high on the route.  One of the best and more challenging routes on the wall
content.location: Middle Man extension

content.description: Positive pockets most of the way, to a crux just below the last clip. Make sure to find the two finger jugs!
content.location: Middle Man has the same start as Clips from the Bong and branches left after the 4th bolt. It traverses left for 3 more bolts to the anchor.

content.description: Starts out mellow to a bit of an awkward move out right, then though some smaller hard to find holds to a good slab. Good Route. Don't let people hate on this route it is not as bad as people say. Fun holds and movement.
content.location: The right most route on the Headwall.

content.description: A 3 bolt extension to the rad Koona, move left after the anchor of Koona on good holds to a delicate finish. Good stuff. Just adds more climbing to a good route, doesn't increase the grade.
content.protection: 3 more bolts from the top of Koona to Oval biners at the anchor.
content.location: Extension of Koona.

content.description: A shorter route on the headwall, long moves on good holds with a tricky crux on smaller feet.
content.location: Just to the right of Time Will Tell with tan hangers. Left of Middle Man.

content.description: A worthy warm up which is not quite as sharp as those to the right.  Fun movement and tight bolting where you clip the last bolt just 8" from the anchors.  As you struggle to clip the anchors you'll realize two things: 1) why the last clip was so close and 2) there is a big jug up and right of the anchors.
content.location: 3rd route from the right, this starts just left of where the shallow ramp meets the ground.

content.description: Classic Fins pockets.
content.location: Left of obvious Line of Weakness

content.description: Longer and slightly stiffer than Hydroponics (aka Standard/Warm up #2), this is a fun, slightly thin slab.
content.location: Second route from the right on the wall.

content.description: The headwall has a 5.10!  Begin by clipping the first four bolts on 'S Curve' but instead of traversing way out right, continue straight up the easy slab on perfect rock.
content.location: Left-most route on the Head Wall.

climbs.name: Bong's Away (aka: Clips from the Bong)

content.description: Tall! This route goes to the top. Climb the pockets and finish on thin slab.
content.location: Shares start with Middle Man, but heads right at 4th bolt.

climbs.name: Bolt to Bolt Sailsman (aka: Virgins of Howe)

content.description: A somewhat cryptic off balance route.  A few big reaches and a technical sections will see you to the chains
content.location: 2nd route left of Ghost in the Shell

content.description:
Despite the whimsical name, this route is a challenge!

Tree stump marks the start of this climb.
content.location: Right of Al's Diner, starts right at the cutoff stump

content.description: A terrific direct finish to Yukon Gold.  Clip the first six bolts of Yukon Gold to the giant pod hueco.  Instead of heading up the right side of the pod to the shared anchor, continue up the left side of the pod past four more bolts of amazing climbing.  The crux of the route is still at the fifth bolt, but the new finish is much more satisfying than the Yukon Gold finish.
content.location: Begin on Yukon Gold, but continue straight up the left side of the giant pod after the sixth bolt.

content.description:
(aka Line of Weakness)

11a (Stems and Seeds) to the first set of anchors, 12a to the top. 11a part is quite sharp but good movement, the top climbs well with a very distinct crux.
content.location: Route just to the right of Ghost in the Shell. Extension of Stems and seeds. It goes up the obvious black, jagged line of weakness.

content.description: head straight up easier climbing with some interesting moves and amazing crimps to a hard crux with bad feet.  After you stick the crux moves, crimp your way to the top.
content.location: right of white rhino, tan painted hangers

climbs.name: Al's Diner
climbs.fa: Erik Leidecker, equipped by Alex McMeekin

content.description: Easier climbing on bigger holds lead to a marginal rest, then the crux at mid height where you can get settled on the 'shocker monos' (index and pinky) or a double set of marginal crimps. Either way you have to make a BIG move to a nice pocket to clip (big for me at 5'8", -2). Find your way through a multitude of interesting holds and either escape right of the bolt line in easier, but harder to read grey rock, or use the nice pockets up the face for a little harder finish.
content.location: Just left of the cutoff stump and the start of Bean Fiddler, it skirts the right side of a wide blonde streak. This is the 7th route from the left.
